data.title: Colin Mochrie's Arts Club Reunion — South Granville BIA
data.meta_description: Legendary Canadian improviser Colin Mochrie returns to the Arts Club for a limited engagement improv show.
data.text:
Legendary Canadian improviser Colin Mochrie returns to the Arts Club for a limited engagement improv show.

Colin Mochrie is an alumnus of Toronto's famous Second City comedy troupe and is considered one of the world’s leading improvisers. He is best known for his 19-year tenure on the improvisation series Whose Line Is It Anyway? Colin was also a cast member of CBC’s This Hour Has 22 Minutes from 2001–2003. With his wife, Debra McGrath, he produced, wrote, and starred in the CBC show Getting Along Famously. Currently, he is part of a very successful live improv tour with his Whose Line Is It Anyway? castmate Brad Sherwood and is engaged in many diverse projects. Colin is three-time Canadian Comedy Award winner, including being named Canadian Comedy Person of the Year in 2013.

Don’t miss this show—get your tickets here!
